title: Does smoking weed help studying? - Quora

response.answer_text: Short answer: It depends on who you are. For me, personally it did and still does. I recently earned a B.S. in Biochemistry while basically being a chronic pothead. Keep in mind, that I am also a medical user who uses it for psychiatric issues (PTSD), and pain from previous injuries as a martial artist (kimura locks are not fun to be in). It works for me personally because it prevents PTSD symptoms (flashbacks, anxiety, etc), and also physical pain. I consider myself motivated and studious, so I can’t really say that weed helps my studying directly. Rather, in an indirect way, it alleviates the other issues I have so I can function better. Much to my fortune, most, if not all, workplaces and institutions I have worked or attended have an “out of sight, out of mind” policy. I perceive this as an incentive to ensure the quality of my work and writing is excellent. I seek to show in my future answers that people who put their faith into my skills are not stifled by my habits. Another big factor is the strain of weed you’re using. People will say sativa for focus and wakefulness, and indica for relaxation and sleep. This an imprecise rule of thumb that is continually being challenged by the myriad of hybrids and growing conditions that are being innovated and put into practice. Additionally, the terpenes, seem to make a noticeable difference. Terpenes are the compounds that offer the fragrance and flavor of the weed. For example, strains like OG Kush that have high amounts of the terpene pinene may help with memory and alertness[1]. In my opinion, if you’re a motivated and/or productive person, weed won’t change that. If you’re a lazy piece of shit, weed will certainly amplify that. So if you didn’t go through the same thing I did, it might or might not work as well for you as it does me. . Let me know how it works out! Edited 12/15/19 to add in some better grammar and some content I feel that I should make clear. Footnotes[1] What Is Pinene and What Are the Benefits of This Cannabis Terpene? | Leafly
